review: I love being able to view HD video on my TVs without the wires.  The problem is that these devices don't stay connected 100% of the time.  I'd say about half of the time they disconnect from the network and have to be setup again.  I've even taken it to the point where I've reconfigured my wireless router to get it to work according to Google's support.  Still not perfect and I'm not about to give up on 'em yet.  Hopefully an update will take care of the issue.  For under $40 it's a great technology.

review: This is by far the simplest thing to set up as for as a streaming dongle. It works pretty flawlessly, no buffering, in HD, and very fast. I bought one to "try out" as I do not have cable TV and was sick of hooking my laptop up to the HDMI port on my television to stream from that. That setup worked but it was a lot of back and forth and clean up after done watching - was hard to truly relax. Chanced this dongle not knowing how it exactly worked, but was truly a great purchase. Easy to lay on the couch and change what you're watching by a touch on your smart phone. Mainly do YouTube but recently tried Netflix and it works perfectly. No real complaints at all. The only things to note is sometimes the YouTube app on my phone resets and I can no longer access what is currently streaming on my TV, but that's the phone's problem, not the chromecasts's.
